title: 'The Wizard of the Kremlin': Inside the turbulent Latvian shoot of Assayas's film
subhead: Olivier Assayas's film, adapted from Giuliano da Empoli's eponymous book, was shot in Latvia, where the costly project encountered unexpected financial obstacles and faced criticism over what was seen as an overly positive portrayal of Russian figures.

title: Trump says will 'de-escalate' in Minneapolis after shooting backlash, rejects 'assassin' label used for Pretti
Iran warns against 'instability' after US strike group arrives
Far-right ex-MEP tries to explain illicit work his assistants did for the party at Le Pen's appeal trial
subhead: Bruno Gollnisch, a former MEP and the far-right party's ex-second-in-command, had to explain tasks done by his three parliamentary assistants, including party figurehead Jean-Marie Le Pen's private secretary and Yann Le Pen, his daughter.

title: Netanyahu says Israel will focus on disarming Hamas and demilitarizing Gaza
subhead: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejected the possibility of commencing reconstruction work in Gaza before accomplishing the missions of disarming Hamas and of demilitarizing Gaza. He additionally stated that Israel would continue to 'exercise security control from the Jordan [River] to the sea, and that applies to the Gaza Strip as well.'

title: Social pressure, puberty and sexism push teenage girls out of sports, study finds
subhead: A survey by French health insurance provider MGEN reveals that nearly half of young girls reported giving up sports, despite genuine interest, due to social constraints, gender stereotypes or changes in their bodies.

title: Czech billionaire Kretinsky's takeover of Fnac Darty aims to block Chinese giant JD.com's influence
subhead: Daniel Kretinsky launched a takeover bid for Fnac Darty, where he was already the largest shareholder. If successful, he could prevent the e-commerce giant JD.com from gaining an indirect stake in the retailer. The French government is closely monitoring the deal.

France's Assemblée Nationale approves social media ban for under-15s
subhead: The legislation also bans the use of mobile phones by students in high schools. Backed by the government, the bill put forward by MP Laure Miller will benefit from a fast-track procedure, announced by President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Footage shows death of Alex Pretti, killed by US Border Patrol in Minneapolis
subhead: The 37-year-old nurse was killed Saturday after federal immigration agents fired at least 10 shots.

title: Eiffel Tower to honor 72 women scientists for posterity
subhead: On Monday, a multidisciplinary commission presented the mayor of Paris with a list of 72 names of women who will join the exclusively male scientists whose names are inscribed on the frieze of the 'Iron Lady.'

title: France's municipal elections, a powerful indicator of the country's mood
